meanings.definition: Straps worn over the shoulders to hold up trousers.
meanings.sent1: He wore red suspenders to keep his pants up.
meanings.sent2: The old man's suspenders matched his bow tie perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The clown's suspenders were so long, they kept getting tangled in his oversized shoes.
meanings.sent4: Her suspenders were like colorful ribbons holding up her spirits.
meanings.sent5: The cowboy's suspenders jingled as he walked, adding a musical touch to the rodeo.

meanings.definition: To temporarily stop or delay something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to suspend the class for a fire drill.
meanings.sent2: They decided to suspend the project until they had more information.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to suspend adding the final ingredient until the oven was preheated.
meanings.sent4: The decision to suspend the game due to bad weather disappointed the fans.
meanings.sent5: The suspense in the room was palpable as they waited to hear if they would suspend the meeting.
